summary: Fleetwood Mac is a popular rock band that formed in London in 1967. The original members were Peter Green, Mick Fleetwood, Jeremy Spencer, and Bob Brunning. They had early success with blues music and hits like "Albatross." The band's lineup changed over the years, with Christine McVie, Lindsey Buckingham, and Stevie Nicks joining in the 1970s. This new trio gave the band a pop rock sound, and their album "Rumours" became one of the best-selling albums ever. The band has had many hits, sold over 120 million records, and won several awards.
title: Fleetwood Mac
